meanings.definition: To bring upon oneself again (a liability or obligation)
meanings.sent1: If you forget to pay your bills on time, you may reincurs late fees.
meanings.sent2: She knew that missing the deadline would reincurs more work for her.
meanings.sent3: John accidentally deleted his project and had to reincurs all the effort.
meanings.sent4: The reckless driver's behavior will reincurs severe consequences.
meanings.sent5: Neglecting regular maintenance will inevitably reincurs costly repairs.

meanings.definition: To become subject to (a penalty or consequence) again
meanings.sent1: After breaking the rules, he will reincurs the same punishment.
meanings.sent2: If you violate the terms, you will reincurs the penalty.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to reincurs the same scolding twice.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring warnings will only reincurs further trouble.
meanings.sent5: Repeatedly speeding will eventually reincurs a license suspension.
